poem:
Title: "The Grasp of Gold"

In steel towers stark and cold,
Men of suits reap a harvest of gold.
Their pockets burgeon, dulled hearts pound,
As pulsing profits confound. 
In the race for lucre, they're renowned,
Disdaining earth's despair, profound.
No time for simple joys compound,
Bankers in their domain, unbound. 
God's silence echoes all around,
In their temples of greed, resound.
